definition:
The integrated use of
assigned and supporting capabilities and activities, mutually
supported by intelligence, to affect adversary decision makers to
achieve or promote specific objectives. These capabilities and
activities include but are not limited to operations security,
military deception, psychological operations, electronic warfare,
physical attack and/or destruction, and special information
operations, and could also include computer network attack. See also
computer network attack, defensive information operations, electronic
warfare, information operations, intelligence, military deception,
operations security, psychological operations, special information
operations.

positive_examples: This is an example of offensive information operation.
The offensive information operation demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed offensive information operation in this context.
A typical case of offensive information operation would involve these features.
The concept of offensive information operation applies here.
Military information operations designed to attack, degrade, or destroy adversary information systems and decision-making capabilities.
negative_examples: This is an example of defensive information operation, not offensive information operation.
This represents information operation in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: DefensiveInformationOperation, or other types of InformationOperation
